title: Credit Fraud
body:
Been thinking, what happens with credit fraud, can't people just loophole it by making smurfs and using those to gift? Or are both accounts banned for it?

Or if they use the rp for the smurf account then gift gifts instead.

replies.body: The content gifted will be removed from the gifted account and the account which issued the chargeback will be banned.
But the actual player still gets off free.

No.

The account which purchased the RP and issued a chargeback gets banned.

The account which the content was gifted to - the content will be removed.

Nobody wins.

yes but the player that actually did the crime still gets away without punishment.

Or say one gifts self rp, then buys hextech, what happens to that?? the object is consumed and the points of disenchanting may have been consumed in a legitimate item, what would happen then.

The player who issued the chargeback (fraud) would be permanently banned.

If you're referring to law enforcement, Riot may or may not take the case to them as the fraudulent activities would basically be reversed as Seras Dragon stated.

To the best of my knowledge any items granted from the purchased chest (skins essence etc) would be removed just as a normal skin would be. It would essentially be a reversal in the case of them redeeming the essence I imagine, in that they would get the shard back and lose the essence.
